headlines.title: World Leaders Engage in Epic Dance-Off to Settle Trade Dispute
headlines.summary: Escalating trade tensions took a surprising turn when leaders of disputing countries decided to settle the matter through a dance-off. In a move lauded by dance community, where leaders' dance skills are being scrutinized instead of their political acumen.
headlines.author: Jittery Jill Jackson

headlines.title: Amazon Acquires Siberia: Prime Shipping Now Available
headlines.summary: In a shocking move, CEO, Jeff Bezos added Siberia to his shopping cart. Customers in Siberia can now enjoy 2-day delivery and ice-cold deals year-round. Environmentalists question the legality, but Siberian natives are just happy they can finally order heated socks.
headlines.author: E-commerce Eva Evans

headlines.title: Apple Launches iEye, The Ultimate Retina Display
headlines.summary: The tech giant reveals its latest invention, the Apple iEye. It's not just another device, it's a full-eye replacement enhancing human vision with digital capabilities. Critics question privacy concerns, while others are just thrilled about finally seeing the world in 4K.
headlines.author: Techy Terry Thompson

headlines.title: Kanye West Declares Himself New Da Vinci, Still Can't Draw a Straight Line
headlines.summary: Music mega-star and part-time presidential candidate, Kanye West, proclaimed himself the reincarnation of Leonardo Da Vinci. Art critics remain skeptical after examining his abstract doodle of a stick figure riding a bicycle.
headlines.author: Artsy Alice Anderson

headlines.title: Aliens Win Interstellar Olympics, Earth Athletes Demand Drug Testing
headlines.summary: Following the Intergalactic Olympics' conclusion, earth athletes demand alien winners undergo drug testing. Despite the uproar, event organizers maintain that 'Martian juice' is merely a high-protein shake.
headlines.author: Sporty Sam Smith

weather: Partly cloudy with a chance of flying pigs. Highs of 75, lows of -15. Yes, that's right, -15. Someone left the freezer door open again.

letterFromCitizen.name: Conspiracy Carl
letterFromCitizen.letter: Ever noticed how every time there's an election, the price of avocados drops? Wake up people! They're using avocados to control our minds! Trust me, it's all in Chapter 7 of my upcoming book, 'Guacamole Gate: How Avocados are Ruining Democracy'.
